rename.from: [Bug]: From within a reporter there is no easy way to know what reference snapshot is missing
rename.to: [Bug]: Cannot access info about missing reference snapshot from a custom reporter

rename.from: [Bug]: Cannot access info about missing reference snapshot from a custom reporter
rename.to: [Bug]: Missing expected reference snapshot file name (PW does not pass the info to a reporter).

body: üí° I just thought of traversing through the `testCase` object and re-creating our `snapshotPathTemplate`, maybe it can be a way out.

Looks like you want something like https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/pull/24446#discussion_r1285606473.

Relates https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/24310

It is close, but not really. I don't want any change in UI mode. 
**I want PW to provide the reporter with the name/filepath of the expected reference snapshot when PW informs about an error of missing reference snapshot.** PW knows how it should be named, he is looking for it, that's why PW can say it is missing. You already have the name and everything, but it is not sent with the test result.

issue.title: [Bug]: Snapshot Path is Unexpectedly Auto-Shortened

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version

1.44.0

### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/gwendolyngoetz/playwright-path-naming
2. Start the simple web server `node server.js`

To view previous behavior

1. cd playwright-v1.42.1
2. npm install
3. npx playwright install chromium
4. npx playwright test
5. You will see a failed snapshot image compare, expected.
6. Look at the paths for attachments 2 and 3

To view the changed behavior do the same steps as above, but go into the playwright-v1.43.0 directory.

This occurs starting on v1.43.0 and later.

### Expected behavior

Prior image path was something like this:

`tmp/test-output/example-lorem-ipsum-dolor-sit-amet-consectetur-adipiscing-elit-sed-do-eiusmod-tempor-incididunt/example_test/one-two-three-four-actual.png`

### Actual behavior

On v1.43.0 or later (including next) the path and file name have changed. Part of the path is now replaced with `fcf62` in this example and the file name has been merged with what used to be an additional directory.

`tmp/test-output/example-lorem-ipsum-dolor--fcf62-o-eiusmod-tempor-incididunt/example-test-one-two-three-four-actual.png`

### Additional context

I don't actually care about the full path naming per se. What I need the original format for is to be able to do the following:
- Copy the updated version of the image into a folder along with it's test name path. Example: `updated_images/example_text/one-two-three-four.png`
- Take the original, diff, and updated versions and stitch them together into a single file. This was something Jest was doing before we migrated to the Playwright runner and folks wanted to keep it since it can be quicker than always getting an artifact from github and running the trace viewer.

I can code around the shortened path, but at the point where in the global teardown when I do the image juggling I don't have any info to work with except the path when trying to determine how to change `example-test-one-two-three-four-actual.png` into `example_text/one-two-three-four.png`.

### Environment

```shell
System:
    OS: Linux 6.8 Ubuntu 24.04 LTS 24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat)
    CPU: (32) x64 AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D 16-Core Processor
    Memory: 40.47 GB / 62.02 GB
    Container: Yes
  Binaries:
    Node: 22.0.0 - ~/.config/nvm/versions/node/v22.0.0/bin/node
    npm: 10.5.1 - ~/.config/nvm/versions/node/v22.0.0/bin/npm
  IDEs:
    VSCode: 1.89.1 - /usr/bin/code
  Languages:
    Bash: 5.2.21 - /usr/bin/bash
  npmPackages:
    @playwright/test: 1.43.0 => 1.43.0
```

body:
The issue still blocks us from updating the PW.

I have tried to recreate the snapshot file name like this:

The test name part ‚úÖ:
```
function getFullTestName(test: TestCase | Suite): string {
  return test.parent?.type === 'describe'
    ? `${getFullTestName(test.parent)} ${test.title}`
    : test.title;
}

// Returns: "Agenda view displays empty state picture instead of the content when inventory is empty"
```

The platform part ‚úÖ:
`testCase.parent.project()?.name`

‚ùå But I have no direct way to get the screenshot index number.

Could you please add a new property to `result.attachments` objects, containing the expected original snapshot filename? **You already have it computed, just send it to the reporter pretty please**.

issue.title: fix(toHaveScreenshot): sanitize attachment names and paths

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
... unless an array of file-system-friendly parts is provided.

Motivation: attachment name is used as a file system path when downloading attachments, so we keep them fs-friendly.

References #30693.

issue.title: fix(toHaveScreenshot): attach "expected" when writing a missing expectation

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
Previously, only the "actual" attachment was created, pointing to the file in `test-results`. Now, the "expected" attachment pointing to the file in `__screenshots__` is also created. This will help any reporters that would like to know the "expected" path, for example to do a manual accept/decline of the baseline.

Fixes #30693.
